name: Booking.com
description: First started in 1996, Booking.com is one of the largest eCommerce travel companies in the world.

name: Turkish Airlines
description: Turkish Airlines is the national flag carrier airline of Turkey. They offer flights to 290 destinations in 119 countries.

name: Austrian Airlines
description: Austrian Airlines operates a global route network of approximately 130 destinations, being particularly dense in Central and Eastern Europe.

name: Travelpayouts
description: Travelpayouts helps publishers earn on all types of travel services, including flight tickets, accommodation, cruises, tours, car rentals, insurance, and much more.

name: Points.com
description: Points.com is a company that sells airline or hotel points and miles to consumers that provides a market to exchange and redeem points.

name: Kayak
description: Kayak was the first price comparison website for flight, hotel, and car hire. They’re still one of the leading travel search engines out there thanks to a ton of brand presence.

name: United Vacations
description: United Vacations combines the lowest airfares on United Airlines with everything you need to create the vacation experience you’ve dreamed of.

name: Hawaiian Airlines
description: Hawaiian Airlines, Hawaii's largest and longest-serving airline, offers non-stop service from the U.S mainland and international destinations.

name: flydubai
description: flydubai operates in 95 destinations, serving the Middle East, Africa, Asia, and Europe from Dubai. Book a flight with low airfare.

name: OneTravel
description: What makes OneTravel different from other travel sites is that they focus on a range of specialties for their visitors, including senior, gay and lesbian travel, as well as focusing on travel to exotic locations, such as India.

name: Air Malta
description: Air Malta's routes include most locations in Europe and the Middle East, but they’ve kept their focus on regional rather than international flights.

name: Wingly
description: Wingly is the largest European flight sharing platform. They connect private pilots with passengers for unforgettable sightseeing flights.

name: Emirates
description: Emirates is recognized as one of the premier airlines in the world right now, focused on providing their passengers with a level of comfort (and often luxury) that would have seemed impossible just a few short years ago.

name: Etihad Airways
description: From its Abu Dhabi base, Etihad Airways flies to over 100 existing or announced passenger and cargo destinations in the Middle East, Africa, Europe, Asia, Australia, and the Americas.

name: Qatar Airways
description: Qatar Airlines serves 160 international destinations, and doing so in style in a fleet of the latest jet aircraft. Their efforts have paid off with Qatar Airways being named “Airline of the Year” almost every year since 2011.
